Hi there. I was just wondering why some of your uploads are a different aspect ration to others? Some are 16:9 which is perfect for TVs but most are 21:9
Sorry YIFY - audio SUCKS on this one.

Audio is always stereo because that is what the specs call for. ;)

Why? To be as compliant with as many hardware devices as possible.

For example, the XboX 360 can NOT play 5.1 audio when using x264 with MP4. Many other devices only support stereo today as well. Sadly!

That is the main reason why it's stereo sound in these rips.

If you want 5.1 audio and higher quality audio at that, then you should stick with the full Blu-ray rips.

Audio whiners freakin' chill & do the following with HandBrake for low sound:

1. Video tab select Copy
2. Audio tab select codec (AC3)
3. Container tab select MP4
4. Sound tab select Gain & Channels original.

Literally takes 10 minutes on a half-way decent machine.

First of all, I'd like to thank Yify for really nicely sized rips :)
But I too have to complain about audio...
In my opinion, it has absolutely nothing to do with bitrate but the wrongly executed AC3/DTS downmix. For those who aren't aware, Yify encodes stereo (aka 2-ch audio) and it's fine by me. But, to get such an audio from, say, 5.1 AC3/DTS audio track, you first need to do a downmix of all those tracks to just two - left and right. And there is a Center channel that holds the majority of the dialogue - and I feel that particular channel is neglected by Yify team on all their releases!
Notice how everyone complains about very quiet dialogues and too loud explosions, cracks, bangs and whatnot - I believe that is the reason.

So, Yify Team, thanks for all the effort, but it wouldn't kill you to dedicate just a few more minutes of your time and create a proper audio downmix template that doesn't make the central channel quiet as a whisper ;)

@RMK.Ultra - I've downloaded Handbrake and haven't found the exact options you posted, but thanks for the tip all the same - I'll keep digging! ;)
But it isn't a real solution, who would want to tinker with every single download...
And - I watch movies on my LG TV, using its embedded media player, so no, I don't have loads of PC media player options ;)
